settings.name: access-token
settings.label: Access Token
settings.help:
This is an access token generated on the My Tokens page of your High Fidelity account.
Generate a token with the 'domains' scope and paste it here.
This is required to associate this domain-server with a domain in your account.

settings.name: id
settings.label: Domain ID
settings.help: This is your High Fidelity domain ID. If you do not want your domain to be registered in the High Fidelity metaverse you can leave this blank.

settings.name: http-username
settings.label: HTTP Username
settings.help: Username used for basic HTTP authentication.

settings.name: http-password
settings.label: HTTP Password
settings.help: Password used for basic HTTP authentication. Leave this blank if you do not want to change it.

settings.name: enable-filter
settings.label: Enable Positional Filter
settings.help: If enabled, positional audio stream uses lowpass filter

settings.name: unattenuated-zone
settings.label: Unattenuated Zone
settings.help: Boxes for source and listener (corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z, corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z)

settings.name: dynamic-jitter-buffer
settings.label: Dynamic Jitter Buffers
settings.help: Dynamically buffer client audio based on perceived jitter in packet receipt timing

settings.name: static-desired-jitter-buffer-frames
settings.label: Static Desired Jitter Buffer Frames
settings.help: If dynamic jitter buffers is disabled, this determines the target number of frames maintained by the AudioMixer's jitter buffers

settings.name: max-frames-over-desired
settings.label: Max Frames Over Desired
settings.help: The highest number of frames an AudioMixer's ringbuffer can exceed the desired jitter buffer frames by

settings.name: use-stdev-for-desired-calc
settings.label: Use Stdev for Desired Jitter Frames Calc:
settings.help: If checked, Philip's method (stdev of timegaps) is used to calculate desired jitter frames. Otherwise, Fred's method (max timegap) is used

settings.name: window-starve-threshold
settings.label: Window Starve Threshold
settings.help: If this many starves occur in an N-second window (N is the number in the next field), then the desired jitter frames will be re-evaluated using Window A.

settings.name: window-seconds-for-desired-calc-on-too-many-starves
settings.label: Timegaps Window (A) Seconds:
settings.help: Window A contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used to re-evaluate the desired jitter frames when too many starves occur within it.

settings.name: window-seconds-for-desired-reduction
settings.label: Timegaps Window (B) Seconds:
settings.help: Window B contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used as a ceiling for the desired jitter frames value.

settings.name: repetition-with-fade
settings.label: Repetition with Fade:
settings.help: If enabled, dropped frames and mixing during starves will repeat the last frame, eventually fading to silence

settings.name: I-print-stream-stats
settings.label: Print Stream Stats:
settings.help: If enabled, audio upstream and downstream stats of each agent will be printed each second to stdout
